p1: This diagram shows the revenue of a company over time. This is a key metric that indicates the size of the role it plays in the economy. The revenue of a company is simply the total income they've received from doing business over the course of the financial year.
p2: Revenue data comes from a number of sources; firstly from published annual reports and those included in our dataset from North Data. Conglomerates and multinationals whose parent companies are based in the USA usually publish consolidated revenue data in the form of annual filings submitted to the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), the market regulator there. If there is no revenue data for an EU subsidiary of an American company, this could be the reason.
